figure.note: Pencil, pen and ink drawing: gateWith a few small changes, WG has here copied David Roberts's illustration in Thomas Roscoe, The Tourist in Spain. Granada (London, 1835), pp. 72-3: 'The Gate of Justice; Entrance to the Alhambra'.
figure.label: Bab el Adeli.e. Puerta de la Justicia (Gate of Justice), Alhambra, Granada. 'Bab el Adel' does not appear in any of the sources WG is drawing on in these pages, so it may be his own translation of 'Gate of Justice' into Arabic.
figure.ab: Five fingers allude to 5 precepts. Faith. Prayer. Alms. Fasting Pilgrimage.Probably summarising Thomas Roscoe, The Tourist in Spain. Granada (London, 1835), p. 73. WG draws on Roscoe several more times in the following pages.
